meanings.definition: The quality of being prone to digress from the main topic.
meanings.sent1: Her digressiveness during the presentation made it hard to follow her main points.
meanings.sent2: His digressiveness in the essay led to confusion among the readers.
meanings.sent3: The digressiveness of the professor's lecture made the students chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The digressiveness of the novel's plot added an unexpected twist to the story.
meanings.sent5: The digressiveness of the tour guide's stories made the tour more interesting.

meanings.definition: The act of deviating from the main subject in speech or writing.
meanings.sent1: The digressiveness of his speech made it hard to understand his main point.
meanings.sent2: Her digressiveness in the article made it difficult to grasp the central argument.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's digressiveness in his jokes kept the audience entertained.
meanings.sent4: The digressiveness of the conversation took us on a journey of unexpected topics.
meanings.sent5: The writer's digressiveness added layers of complexity to the narrative.
